climbs.name: Throwin' Grandpa's War Medals Off the Bridge
climbs.fa: Blayne Ferrell and Sean McLane, Nov 2020

content.description:
We were inspired to put this one up by the Sinestra-looking crack switch and really enjoyed the climbing. Start in a finger crack in a shallow chimney, break right into the OW face splitter, take it through a roof, and step left into another OW / chimney.

80m rope required
content.location: In a left-facing corner, right of The Pharaoh by around two hundred feet. Plaque at the base

climbs.name: There's Gold in Them Hills
climbs.fa: Blayne Ferrell and Sean McLane, Oct 2020

content.description:
A tower / rim route with lots of off-fists that will test all your crack technique and only needs a single 70. Plus a nice first pitch for cragging. Named after the three #8s we hauled up to establish it, now it goes on a friendlier rack up to 6.

P1) Work up through the sizes from fingers to chimney with one protection bolt. Face holds make for cool moves and less strenuous wide. Traverse in from the right at the start with a hueco jug to avoid a little crumbly rock. 5.10+, singles .5-6, extra 3+4 if desired

P2) Take the right fist crack (a little sandy) through a roof until you can stem left into the hand crack. Use both cracks to get into the "Circumcisor", a chimney with #6s on both sides of a giant, sharp flake. Exit left at the top and make a short traverse into another fist and OW crack. A friend said this was some of the most unique climbing he's done at the creek. 5.11/-

P3) From the belay ledge, head back into the #4s crack as it widens and steepens. A careful traverse right on stacked blocks gets you to a bolt. A second bolt protects the final slab moves to the summit. Tat extends the anchor bolts here for a better pull, so be prepared to replace if crispy. 5.11
content.protection: 1x .5-1, 2x 2-3, 3-4x 4-5, 1x 6, optional 7, alpine draws, heaviest on 4s, 70m required
content.location: Down and right from the Pharaoh belay pedestal. Right-center of the wall
Just a little bit right of The Pharaoh

content.description: A nice 2s and 3s crack gets you started. Then tackle the offset off fingers into a tips crack switch in some softer rock. More thin hands and off fingers takes you to the heartbreaker anchor.
content.location: An obvious route when coming up the approach trail, it splits a large panel and continues above the anchor

climbs.name: Hip Belay the Children
climbs.fa: Sean McLane and Blayne Ferrell, Oct 2020

content.description: A nice warmup for the area with mostly off fingers and hands in a left-facing corner. If you have a small child, a hip belay should be sufficient, right? Or am I over the hill?
content.location: Starts in the same alcove as There's Gold in Them Hills, just right of The Pharaoh

climbs.name: Beef Basin Social Club
climbs.fa: Blayne Ferrell and Sean McLane, Nov 2020

content.description: Worth the slightly sketchy scramble up to the base with a plush cave. So much better than shitter yoga at Beef Basin. Start in a short section of overhanging hands then navigate the fist and OW crack with lots of size changes.
content.location: Right of Throwin' Grandpa's War Medals Off the Bridge and C and P. Go through a tunnel behind a pillar or skirt the bottom until you see another leaning pillar and a ledge about 20' above the rest of the base. Scramble up the middle left side and you will find a cave under that second leaning pillar.
